intro: Callitriche mouterdei, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water-starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Callitrichaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are typically narrow and linear, with a smooth or slightly toothed margin. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in the summer months. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Its rapid growth and ability to form dense mats make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems.
